intro: Ranunculus fallax subsp. fagerstroemii, commonly known as the Fagerström's crowfoot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to subarctic regions of Europe and northern Asia. It features delicate, palmately divided leaves and showy, yellow or white flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky or alpine habitats, often in open areas with poor soil. It has a short growing season and is adapted to cold climates, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Ranunculaceae family.
